forkee.name: electron
forkee.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.title: [Bug]: content::BrowserAccessibilityComWin::get_hyperlink Crashes occur randomly
issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
- [X] I have searched the [issue tracker](https://www.github.com/electron/electron/issues) for a bug report that matches the one I want to file, without success.

### Electron Version

22.3.5

### What operating system are you using?

Windows

### Operating System Version

Windows 10.0.22621(2134)

### What arch are you using?

x64

### Last Known Working Electron version

17

### Expected Behavior

Do not crash!

### Actual Behavior

Crashes occur randomly, often when users click to open certain content for display. The crashes are not consistent; sometimes opening does not result in a crash, while other times it does. The frequency of these incidents is quite high.

The full stack trace is all on [Sentry](https://apifox.sentry.io/share/issue/7668053a86e149f7944fbb0ae19c1bdc/)

```
content::BrowserAccessibilityComWin::get_hyperlink (browser_accessibility_com_win.cc:532)
AccUtils::get_hyperlink
IA2ProxyTextRange::GetChildrenWithinRangeUsingText
IA2ProxyTextRange::GetChildrenWithinRange
IA2ProxyTextRange::IterateOverSubRanges
IA2ProxyTextRange::IterateOverSubRanges
IA2ProxyTextRange::EvaluateFunctionRecursively
IA2ProxyTextRange::GetText
```

### Testcase Gist URL

_No response_

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: [Bug]: Title bar appears when clicking on a transparent window
issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
- [X] I have searched the [issue tracker](https://www.github.com/electron/electron/issues) for a bug report that matches the one I want to file, without success.

### Electron Version

27.0.0

### What operating system are you using?

Windows

### Operating System Version

10.0.19042

### What arch are you using?

x64

### Last Known Working Electron version

26.4.1

### Expected Behavior

Window should stay transparent

### Actual Behavior

![image](https://github.com/electron/electron/assets/10595986/a1868342-c55b-46c3-8172-a2db3d3b7e06)
After clicking a transparent window, a weird title bar appears

### Testcase Gist URL

https://gist.github.com/t57ser/0bff361397c8eba35317af8ecdc540eb

### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body: what actually you want to be in your project

issue.title: [Bug]: From 26.4.1 to 26.4.2 breaks build
issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
- [X] I have searched the [issue tracker](https://www.github.com/electron/electron/issues) for a bug report that matches the one I want to file, without success.

### Electron Version

26.4.2

### What operating system are you using?

macOS

### Operating System Version

Sonoma 14.0

### What arch are you using?

arm64 (including Apple Silicon)

### Last Known Working Electron version

26.4.1

### Expected Behavior

A patch bump should not break app building.

26.4.1 works fine.
26.4.2 breaks

### Actual Behavior

Build crashes and opens this MacOS dialog:

comment.body:
If anyone else finds this via google:

`npm cache clean --force`
`yarn cache clean --force`
`pnpm store prune`

nuke everything package wise.

re-install and it works.

must have cached a corrupted version somewhere?

issue.title: [Bug]: ChromeDriver hangs when requesting WindowHandles after opening new window
issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
- [X] I have searched the [issue tracker](https://www.github.com/electron/electron/issues) for a bug report that matches the one I want to file, without success.

### Electron Version

v26.0.0

### What operating system are you using?

Windows

### Operating System Version

Windows 10 Version 22H2

### What arch are you using?

x64

### Last Known Working Electron version

v25.9.1

### Expected Behavior

We automate testing against one of our Electron applications by using ChromeDriver (via Selenium) to interact with webpages. In particular, one test looks for newly-opened windows by asking the driver to provide it with a set of handles to all open windows for that driver (what I assume is [this](https://www.selenium.dev/selenium/docs/api/java/org/openqa/selenium/WebDriver.html#getWindowHandles()), although the actual call is done by a C# wrapper). After opening a new window in our Electron application, we would expect a call to get the window handles to return all available window handles, including a handle to the newly created window.

### Actual Behavior

The call to get all window handles hangs for a while before eventually timing out. This only seems to occur after a window has been newly-opened, and only for certain windows.

### Testcase Gist URL

_No response_

### Additional Information

To be blunt, this isn't an issue with Electron's code itself - we've sourced this to a specific [Chromium change](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4546274) made sometime between Chromium v115.0.5786.0 and Chromium v115.0.5790.0 (confirmed by testing with Electron v26.0.0-nightly.20230524, where the issue does not occur, and Electron v26.0.0-nightly.2023.0525, where it does). We've written up a [Chromium issue](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1493733) to track this, but wanted to open an issue here as well in the event that this might be something Electron could fix with a Chromium patch if Chromium doesn't fix it.

comment.body: having the same issue, thanks for reporting

issue.title: [Bug]: visibilitychange event doesn't fire when backgroundThrottling is set to false
issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
- [X] I have searched the [issue tracker](https://www.github.com/electron/electron/issues) for a bug report that matches the one I want to file, without success.

### Electron Version

27.0.2

### What operating system are you using?

macOS

### Operating System Version

Ventura 13.5.2

### What arch are you using?

x64

### Last Known Working Electron version

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

`visibilitychange` event fires when coming back to app.

### Actual Behavior

`visibilitychange` event doesn't fire.

### Testcase Gist URL

_No response_

### Additional Information

This happens when `backgroundThrottling` is set to false.

Seems to be related to https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/39223

issue.title: [Bug]: `window.print()` without printers causes the main process to crash
issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [x] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [x] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
- [X] I have searched the [issue tracker](https://www.github.com/electron/electron/issues) for a feature request that matches the one I want to file, without success.

### Electron Version

14.0.1

### What operating system are you using?

Ubuntu

### Operating System Version

5.11.0-37-generic #41-Ubuntu SMP Mon Sep 20 16:39:20 UTC 2021 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### What arch are you using?

x64

### Last Known Working Electron version

13.4.0

### Expected Behavior

Calling `window.print()` should open the print window, even if there are no printers installed in the system.

### Actual Behavior

Calling `window.print()` from the renderer process crashes the main process.

### Testcase Gist URL

https://gist.github.com/85a5466567215173419a17982e79becb

### Additional Information

When the process crashes, the terminal prints:
```Crashing due to FD ownership violation:
#0 0x5616b9f1e143 <unknown>
#1 0x5616b9fc517c <unknown>
#2 0x5616b9fc5141 close
#3 0x7f4c4568817b <unknown>

Failed to get crash dump id.
Report Id: --2021-09-27 12:

Failed to get crash dump id.
Report Id: --2021-09-27 12:
PATH/TO/PROJECT/node_modules/electron/dist/electron exited with signal SIGILL
```

When calling `BrowserWindow.print()`, the console prints:
`[22590:0927/121740.971531:ERROR:print_backend_cups.cc(218)] CUPS: Error getting default printer: No destinations added.`
and the print callback *is* called with `[ false, 'no valid printers available' ]` for args. The main process does not crash, but the print window never opens (I have filed a similar issue back at v10.x: https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/25498)


On v13.4.0, a similar error message is printed, but the process does not crashes (or does, but recovers immediately somehow):

```
Crashing due to FD ownership violation:
#0 0x564e03bc1143
<unknown>
#1 0x564e03c6817c <unknown>
#2 0x564e03c68141 close
#3 0x7f20e79ea17b <unknown>

Electron exited with signal SIGTRAP.
Saving files to temp directory...
Saved files to /tmp/tmp-18241-0f2HhywGTnpu
Electron v13.4.0 started.
```
Also, the print window is correctly displayed, containing only the 'Print to File' option.

comment.body:
This issue persists with Electron version `25.3.0`. Tested on Ubuntu `22.04` LTS. I get the following error when network printers are attached and the app crashes:
```
Crashing due to FD ownership violation:
#0 0x559b77ae8a73 <unknown>
#1 0x559b77adca9c <unknown>
#2 0x559b77adca6b close
#3 0x7efc8cef9ef3 <unknown>
```

issue.title: autoUpdater does not work when have authenticated proxy
issue.body:
- Electron version: `0.36.7`
- Operating system: Windows

The `autoUpdater` module in electron does not appear to be attempting to update all my users on windows from `3.0.1` to `3.1.0`.  It took a clean reinstall of the application on a few computers that I am aware of before it decided there was an update too download.

Upon sniffing out the traffic I could see that an update check request was being sent to fetch the [RELEASES](http://update.googleplaymusicdesktopplayer.com/update/win/3.0.1/RELEASES) file and then didn't attempt to download the obviously available update.

I don't see how it can work for around 80% of users (that number is a guestimate) and not work for the rest.

The update server is here http://update.googleplaymusicdesktopplayer.com/update/{platform}/{version} 
The update code is here https://github.com/MarshallOfSound/Google-Play-Music-Desktop-Player-UNOFFICIAL-/blob/master/src/main/features/core/autoUpdater.js

issue.title: Setting image src from disk not working on Windows.
issue.body: I am trying to create something like a file explorer, where the user browsers the local file system and I want to display the images in the folders. I have registered a protocol with ``` app.whenReady().then(() => { protocol.handle('atom', (request) => net.fetch('file://' + request.url.slice('atom://'.length))) }) ``` And in the renderer I do ``` ``` This works on macOs without any issues but on Windows I get this error: ``` TypeError: Failed to parse URL from atom://C:\\Users\\myUser\\Pictures\\Screenshots\\Screenshot 2023-02-24 133652.png at new Request (node:internal/deps/undici/undici:7134:19) at AsyncFunction. (node:electron/js2c/browser_init:2:57323) { [cause]: TypeError [ERR_INVALID_URL]: Invalid URL at new NodeError (node:internal/errors:405:5) at new URL (node:internal/url:616:13) at new Request (node:internal/deps/undici/undici:7132:25) at AsyncFunction. (node:electron/js2c/browser_init:2:57323) { input: 'atom://C:\\Users\\myUser\\Pictures\\Screenshots\\Screenshot 2023-02-24 133652.png', code: 'ERR_INVALID_URL' } ``` Any ideas on what the problem might be?

comment.body:
Thanks for reaching out!

Because we treat our issues list as the team's backlog, we close issues that are questions since they don't represent a task needing to be completed. This forum is for raising bugs or requesting new features, and for most questions about Electron there are a lot of more appropriate [community options](https://github.com/electron/electron#community). There are helpful people in this [Discord](https://discord.gg/electronjs) or the [subreddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/electronjs) that should be willing to point you in the right direction.

issue.title: <webview>.getWebContentsId is not a function with contextIsolation enabled
issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist
<!-- Please ensure you've completed the following steps by replacing [ ] with [x]-->

* [x] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
* [x] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
* [x] I have searched the issue tracker for an issue that matches the one I want to file, without success.

### Issue Details

* **Electron Version:**
  * 4.0.0 through 16.0.0-beta.2
* **Operating System:**
  * NixOS 21.11 x86_64
* **Last Known Working Electron version:**
  * none

### Expected Behavior
Within a preload script, I should be able to get the WebContents ID of a `<webview>` element using `webview.getWebContentsId()` (after the `dom-ready` event fires), whether `contextIsolation` is enabled or disabled.

### Actual Behavior
This only works if `contextIsolation` is disabled. With `contextIsolation` enabled, I get `Uncaught TypeError: webview.getWebContentsId is not a function`.

(Some other way to do this would be fine too, but I haven’t found one.)

### To Reproduce
Electron Fiddle: https://gist.github.com/5a21657fe926111ad18026905d1ed81d

Observe the error in the console, then change `contextIsolation` to `false` and observe that there’s no error.

comment.body: This issue has been automatically marked as stale. **If this issue is still affecting you, please leave any comment** (for example, "bump"), and we'll keep it open. If you have any new additional information—in particular, if this is still reproducible in the [latest version of Electron](https://www.electronjs.org/releases/stable) or in the [beta](https://www.electronjs.org/releases/beta)—please include it with your comment!

issue.title: [Bug]: `webContents.print` fails on macOS with "No printers available on the network"

labels.name: has-repro-gist
labels.description: Issue can be reproduced with code at https://gist.github.com/

issue.body: ### Preflight Checklist - [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project. - [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to. - [X] I have searched the [issue tracker](https://www.github.com/electron/electron/issues) for a bug report that matches the one I want to file, without success. ### Electron Version 22.0.1 ### What operating system are you using? macOS ### Operating System Version macOS Ventura 13.0.1 ### What arch are you using? arm64 (including Apple Silicon) ### Last Known Working Electron version _No response_ ### Expected Behavior Calling the below: ```ts window.webContents.print(undefined) ``` Should open a print dialog, _regardless of whether or not any printers are configured_. ### Actual Behavior When no printers are currently configured, calling the below: ```ts window.webContents.print(undefined, console.log) ``` Yields ```ps false No printers available on the network ``` While calling ```ts window.webContents.executeJavaScript("window.print();") ``` Yields the expected dialog: --- While I can use the second approach, it feels like a workaround rather than a solution. The first approach works fine on Windows 10, perhaps because there are a few default printers such as "Microsoft Print to PDF"? ### Testcase Gist URL https://gist.github.com/8570c187ab7c976b70fd84835db5f27c ### Additional Information Could be slightly related to https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/24664. The error is not the same, but the result is. According to comments on that issue, this is "expected behavior" - but it is also noted that it is not per spec, as other applications behave differently.

issue.title: [Bug]:  Network service crashed, restarting service.
issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
- [X] I have searched the [issue tracker](https://www.github.com/electron/electron/issues) for a bug report that matches the one I want to file, without success.

### Electron Version

17.0.0

### What operating system are you using?

Other Linux

### Operating System Version

RHEL8 and Fedora

### What arch are you using?

x64

### Last Known Working Electron version

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

In the recent weeks, several Electron Apps that I am using on Linux have started to report this error message on Linux (RHEL8):

```[2400910:1025/102533.526148:ERROR:network_service_instance_impl.cc(663)] Network service crashed, restarting service.
```
Teams for Linux, reported here: https://github.com/IsmaelMartinez/teams-for-linux/issues/998
or
```5898:ERROR:network_service_instance_impl.cc(663)] Network service crashed, restarting service.```
Standard Notes, reported here: https://github.com/standardnotes/forum/issues/3312

This causes a delay of several seconds on startup. For teams on Linux, the App does not even work anymore.



### Actual Behavior

No error should be seen and the apps should work/start fine.

### Testcase Gist URL

_No response_

### Additional Information

RHEL8 and Fedora 37 x86_64

comment.body:
RHEL9 works too (as does Fedora37).
Any reason why electron on RHEL8 stopped working recently?

issue.title: [Bug]: content::BrowserAccessibilityComWin::get_hyperlink Crashes occur randomly
issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.

### Electron Version

22.3.5

### What operating system are you using?

Windows

### Operating System Version

Windows 10.0.22621(2134)

### What arch are you using?

x64

### Last Known Working Electron version

17

### Expected Behavior

Do not crash!

### Actual Behavior

Crashes occur randomly, often when users click to open certain content for display. The crashes are not consistent; sometimes opening does not result in a crash, while other times it does. The frequency of these incidents is quite high.

The full stack trace is all on [Sentry](https://apifox.sentry.io/share/issue/7668053a86e149f7944fbb0ae19c1bdc/)

```
content::BrowserAccessibilityComWin::get_hyperlink (browser_accessibility_com_win.cc:532)
AccUtils::get_hyperlink
IA2ProxyTextRange::GetChildrenWithinRangeUsingText
IA2ProxyTextRange::GetChildrenWithinRange
IA2ProxyTextRange::IterateOverSubRanges
IA2ProxyTextRange::IterateOverSubRanges
IA2ProxyTextRange::EvaluateFunctionRecursively
IA2ProxyTextRange::GetText
```

### Testcase Gist URL

_No response_

### Additional Information

_No response_
